summary: inTRODUCTION Hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) ranks third in the cause of cancer death. it has several malignant biological properties including aggressive growth, frequent metastases, and poor survival rates. therapy of HCC includes surgery, radiation, transarterial chemoembolization, transplantation, and systemic chemotherapy. the lentiviral vector of short harpin RNA (shRNA) against IGF-1R gene is able to be applied to gene function studies and gene therapy for cancers and other diseases [13–15]. RESULTS IGF-1R mRNA is up-regulated in HCC cells and human HCC tissues. there were no differences between the high and low IGF-1R mRNA expression groups regarding age, sex, tumor size, and AFP level. the above results suggest that IGF-1R overexpression is involved in HCC development and is closely correlated to poor tumour differentiation and TEPV. lentivirus-mediated RNAi effectively suppresses the expression of IGF-1R mRNA and protein in HCC cells. western blot showed that the amount of IGF-1R protein in the cells of IGF-1R siRNA group was also decreased greatly compared with the negative control or blank control. Knockdown of IGF-1R significantly inhibits proliferation of HCC cells. treatment of both Huh7 and Hep3B cells with lentivirus-mediated IGF-1R RNAi was associated with a time-dependent inhibition of with negative control, or the untreated cells (blank control). this outcome indicates that IGF-1R inhibition promotes the apoptosis of the HCC cells. the level of AFP secretion was measured in the RNAi is a relatively new technology and shows promise for the development of therapeutic gene knockdown. lentivirus can efficiently infect both dividing and non-dividing cells. lentivirus-mediated shRNA targeting human IGF-1R gene was highly capable of stable knockdown of IGF-1R mRNA and protein expression in Huh7 and Hep3B cells. lentivirus-mediated RNAi targeting IGF-1R could lead to the remarkable proliferation inhibition, apoptosis induction, and reduction of invasion activity in osteosarcoma cells. in vitro and in vivo findings suggest that IGF-1R inhibition may play a significant role in the development, progression, and metastasis of HCC. this is the first study that demonstrates the therapeutic value of IGF-1R inhibition by lentivirus-mediated RNAi in vivo. we demonstrated that ectopic overexpression of midkine remarkably remedied inhibition of Huh7 cell proliferation, migration, and invasion caused by IGF-1R suppression. the reduced midkine expression may contribute, at least in part, to significantly reduced HCC proliferation, migration, and invasion capability. sequences of shRNA targeting human IGF-1R gene were synthesized and cloned into a lentiviral vector HL-7702, and 293T cell lines were cultured in Dulbecco's modified Eagle medium (Gibco BRL, Rockville, MD, USA) all cell lines were maintained in a 37°C incubator with 5% CO2. lentiviral particles (lentivirus-IGF-1R siRNA and lentivirus-negative control) were produced by co-transfection of pLVX-shRNA2 vectors with Lenti-XTM HTX Packaging System (Clontech) into 293T cells according to manufacturer's instructions. about 48 h after transfection, the lentiviruses were harvested. each experiment was repeated thrice and all reactions were carried out in triplicate. Western blot Protein extraction from the cell lines or tumor tissues isolated from the nude mice was performed as described previously. apoptosis was detected by a flow cytometer (Beckman Coulter, Brea, CA, USA) the experiment was independently repeated three times. the transwells were left uncoated or coated with Matrigel. mice were injected subcutaneously into the right flank with 5 106 Huh7 cells expressing IGF-1R siRNA. mice were randomized into the IGF-1R siRNA, negative control, and blank control groups. they were injected intracutaneously with about 6 107 copies of lentivirus-IGF-1R siRNA. the signals (wavelength of 532 nm) were scanned using innoScan 300 microarray scanner. Statistical analysis Categorical data were evaluated by 2 or Fisher's exact tests. results were considered statistically significant at P 0.05.
